newsitem.title: UK: ARA bunkers ease, rest of Europe static.
newsitem.headline: ARA bunkers ease, rest of Europe static.

text.p: ARA bunkers were slightly weaker on Thursday with the lacklustre state of the high sulphur barge market weighing on prices, brokers said.
Rotterdam 380 CST was put at $94/$96 fob against $96/$97 fob and 180 CST material, which remains in tight supply, was quoted around $102/$104.
"Demand's pretty healthy," said one broker. "I think the dead barge market is holding prices down."
Hamburg prices played catch-up with Rotterdam with 380 CST put at $99/$100 - some $3 lower than Wednesday. "It's not to busy but we're picking up bits and bobs," said a local broker.
Mediterranean bunkers were static with 380 CST in Algeciras quoted at $102/$104 and in Augusta at $109/$111.
In Piraeus, demand was average and prices were steady at $102/$104 for 380 CST and $109/$111 for $180.
In Durban, prices were also unchanged with 180 CST quoted at $96 to $98 and diesel put at $215/$216.
